column4: I have a problem with my tty:s is not loaded so I only get black screen trying to change.. im on Karmic
worked before upgradring to Karmic
Is there somthing that mess up the load script of ttys - and is there something i can do to fix it.. beeing forced to manual load the ttys isn't very fun
Anybody have any knowledge that can help me to fix this mess
what script loads the ttys at boot..
must be something wrong with it
anyone?
check the rc.d bootup scripts
where do I find it?
cd /etc/rc....
- I have rc0.d rc1.d up to rc6.d -- but no rc.d
they are the ones
- why so many
for different runlevels
- which runlevel am i running at default now then?
karmic?
- yes
- entering the command runlevel returns unknown
install a program called sysvinit-rc or something like that
- there is a sysvinit-utils ? is that the one.. and what does it do
that is it... it lets you set the bootup scripts manually without messing up the folders of symlinks contained in rc1.d .... 6.d
- how do I run it?
possibly dont change anything, just run it and see what it looks like
sudo sysvinit<TAB> enter
